segments.text: I see the woman at the sink first, drying a plate, completely unaware of the water overflowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's amazing how she doesn't even seem to notice the puddle forming around her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the children behind her, the boy standing on a wobbly stool, reaching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is standing next to him, her hand outstretched, waiting for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is going to fall; that stool looks so unstable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is completely oblivious, just continuing with her chores.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long the sink has been overflowing like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off the faucet soon before the kitchen floods completely.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like a scene from a silent movie, everything happening at once.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe how calm the woman is, given the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR
